transportAdvice: Cairns city centre is compact and walkable, with most tourist attractions, restaurants, and the Esplanade easily reached on foot. A local bus network connects the city to nearby beaches and suburbs, and taxis are readily available for longer trips or transfers to the airport.

weather.description: Peak wet season with heavy tropical downpours, high humidity, and occasional cyclone risk — outdoor activities can be disrupted.
Wet season continues with frequent intense rainfall and very high humidity, though sunny spells still occur between storms.
Still firmly in the wet season with significant rainfall, though totals begin to ease slightly toward the end of the month.
Transitional month as the wet season winds down, with decreasing rain and slightly more comfortable temperatures.
The dry season begins, bringing clear skies, lower humidity, and pleasant warm days ideal for reef and rainforest activities.
One of the best months to visit with reliably dry, sunny weather, comfortable temperatures, and excellent visibility on the reef.
Peak dry season with the coolest and driest conditions of the year — perfect for outdoor adventures and water activities.
Continued dry and sunny weather with low humidity and warm days, making it one of the most popular months for visitors.
Warm and mostly dry with increasing temperatures, still excellent conditions for snorkelling, diving, and hiking.
Temperatures rise noticeably and humidity begins to build as the pre-wet season approaches, with occasional afternoon storms.
The build-up season brings hot, humid conditions and increasing storm activity, with box jellyfish becoming a hazard in coastal waters.
The wet season arrives in earnest with heavy tropical rain, high heat, and humidity — stinger season is in full effect on beaches.
